Operation 'GetOrdersLabelAsync' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. The current description lacks clarity on what the operation actually does (generates labels), who can use it (OBA customers), what inputs are required (order identifiers), and what the output format is (PDF). The summary is somewhat clear but could be more action-oriented. Added context about authentication requirements, parameter usage, and the workaround for document separation issues to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Return a single PDF file with generated label and/or associated document(s)
data.current_description: Reserved for OBA customers only The account "Label format" settings page will control the page format settings used to print the postage label and associated documents. Certain combinations of these settings may prevent associated documents from being printed together with the postage label within a single document. If this occurs the documentType option can be used in a separate call to print missing documents.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate and retrieve postage label PDF for orders
data.description_suggestion: Generates and retrieves a PDF file containing the postage label and associated documents for specified orders. Reserved for OBA customers only. The label format and page settings are controlled by the account's "Label format" settings configuration. Note: Certain format combinations may result in associated documents being generated separately; use the documentType parameter to retrieve missing documents in separate calls if needed. Requires valid order identifiers and Bearer token authentication.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on what the operation actually does (generates labels), who can use it (OBA customers), what inputs are required (order identifiers), and what the output format is (PDF). The summary is somewhat clear but could be more action-oriented. Added context about authentication requirements, parameter usage, and the workaround for document separation issues to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'GetOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable, but description is completely missing. Added details about pagination support, authentication requirement, return content, and parameter guidance for AI agent clarity.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of orders for the authenticated user. Supports filtering and sorting through query parameters. Returns order summary information including order identifiers, status, and timestamps. Use pagination parameters to control result set size and offset.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable, but description is completely missing. Added details about pagination support, authentication requirement, return content, and parameter guidance for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'CreateOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is too generic. Description is missing entirely. Enhanced summary with 'for shipment' context and added comprehensive description explaining batch processing capability, expected inputs (address, items, preferences), return values (order IDs, errors), and side effect (orders ready for label generation).

data.summary_suggestion: Create one or more orders for shipment
data.description_suggestion: Creates one or more orders from the provided order data. Accepts a batch of order requests containing recipient address, item details, and service preferences. Returns confirmation with created order identifiers and any validation errors for failed orders. Orders are immediately available for label generation after successful creation.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description is missing entirely. Enhanced summary with 'for shipment' context and added comprehensive description explaining batch processing capability, expected inputs (address, items, preferences), return values (order IDs, errors), and side effect (orders ready for label generation).

message: Operation 'GetOrdersWithDetailsAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is clear but description only contains access restriction without explaining what the operation returns. Enhanced description to specify what detailed information is included (addresses, items, service details, status history), pagination support, and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Retrieve pageable list of orders with details
data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of orders with complete details for ChannelShipper customers only. Returns comprehensive order information including recipient and sender addresses, item details, service selections, and status history. Supports filtering and sorting through query parameters. Access restricted to ChannelShipper accounts.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description only contains access restriction without explaining what the operation returns. Enhanced description to specify what detailed information is included (addresses, items, service details, status history), pagination support, and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'UpdateOrdersStatusAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is vague about batch capability. Description is completely missing. Improved summary to clarify batch processing and added comprehensive description explaining batch input format, return values, and important side effect that status changes trigger downstream processes.

data.summary_suggestion: Update status for one or more orders
data.description_suggestion: Updates the status for one or more orders in batch. Accepts order identifiers and new status values. Returns confirmation of status updates and any errors for orders that could not be updated. Status changes are immediately reflected in order records and may trigger downstream processes such as label generation or fulfillment workflows.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague about batch capability. Description is completely missing. Improved summary to clarify batch processing and added comprehensive description explaining batch input format, return values, and important side effect that status changes trigger downstream processes.

message: Operation 'DeleteOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate but description needs restructuring for clarity. Reorganized description to lead with the operation purpose, then access restriction, then critical warnings about label invalidation and financial consequences, and finally return information. This structure helps AI agents understand the serious implications before executing the operation.

data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information Please be aware labels generated on orders which are deleted are no longer valid and must be destroyed. Cancelled label information is automatically shared with Royal Mail Revenue Protection, and should a cancelled label be identified on an item in the Royal Mail Network, you will be charged on your account and an additional handling fee applied.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more orders by order identifiers. ChannelShipper customers only. IMPORTANT: Any labels generated for deleted orders become invalid and must be destroyed. Cancelled label information is automatically reported to Royal Mail Revenue Protection. If a cancelled label is identified in the Royal Mail Network, charges and handling fees will be applied to the account. Returns confirmation of deletion and any errors.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description needs restructuring for clarity. Reorganized description to lead with the operation purpose, then access restriction, then critical warnings about label invalidation and financial consequences, and finally return information. This structure helps AI agents understand the serious implications before executing the operation.

message: Operation 'GetSpecificOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable. Description is missing entirely. Added comprehensive description explaining how to specify which orders (comma-separated IDs), what information is returned, and guidance on when to use this operation versus the paginated list endpoint.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves order information for one or more specific orders identified by order identifiers. Accepts comma-separated order IDs as path parameter. Returns order summary data including status, recipient information, and key order details. Use this operation when you need information about particular orders rather than browsing paginated lists.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description is missing entirely. Added comprehensive description explaining how to specify which orders (comma-separated IDs), what information is returned, and guidance on when to use this operation versus the paginated list endpoint.

Enhanced description to explain how to specify orders (comma-separated IDs), what comprehensive details are included (addresses, items, services, pricing, status history), and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for proper AI agent routing.

data.current_summary: Retrieve details of the specific orders
data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves comprehensive details for one or more specific orders identified by order identifiers. ChannelShipper customers only. Accepts comma-separated order IDs as path parameter. Returns complete order information including recipient and sender addresses, all item details, service selections, pricing, and full status history. Access restricted to ChannelShipper accounts.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description only contains access restriction. Enhanced description to explain how to specify orders (comma-separated IDs), what comprehensive details are included (addresses, items, services, pricing, status history), and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for proper AI agent routing.

Operation 'GetOrdersLabelAsync' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. The current description lacks clarity on what the operation actually does (generates labels), who can use it (OBA customers), what inputs are required (order identifiers), and what the output format is (PDF). The summary is somewhat clear but could be more action-oriented. Added context about authentication requirements, parameter usage, and the workaround for document separation issues to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Return a single PDF file with generated label and/or associated document(s)
data.current_description: Reserved for OBA customers only The account "Label format" settings page will control the page format settings used to print the postage label and associated documents. Certain combinations of these settings may prevent associated documents from being printed together with the postage label within a single document. If this occurs the documentType option can be used in a separate call to print missing documents.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate and retrieve postage label PDF for orders
data.description_suggestion: Generates and retrieves a PDF file containing the postage label and associated documents for specified orders. Reserved for OBA customers only. The label format and page settings are controlled by the account's "Label format" settings configuration. Note: Certain format combinations may result in associated documents being generated separately; use the documentType parameter to retrieve missing documents in separate calls if needed. Requires valid order identifiers and Bearer token authentication.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on what the operation actually does (generates labels), who can use it (OBA customers), what inputs are required (order identifiers), and what the output format is (PDF). The summary is somewhat clear but could be more action-oriented. Added context about authentication requirements, parameter usage, and the workaround for document separation issues to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand when and how to use this operation.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current version details of the ChannelShipper & Royal Mail Public API. Returns version information including the API version number and related metadata. message: Operation 'GetOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable, but description is completely missing. Added details about pagination support, authentication requirement, return content, and parameter guidance for AI agent clarity.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of orders for the authenticated user. Supports filtering and sorting through query parameters. Returns order summary information including order identifiers, status, and timestamps. Use pagination parameters to control result set size and offset.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable, but description is completely missing. Added details about pagination support, authentication requirement, return content, and parameter guidance for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'CreateOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is too generic. Description is missing entirely. Enhanced summary with 'for shipment' context and added comprehensive description explaining batch processing capability, expected inputs (address, items, preferences), return values (order IDs, errors), and side effect (orders ready for label generation).

data.summary_suggestion: Create one or more orders for shipment
data.description_suggestion: Creates one or more orders from the provided order data. Accepts a batch of order requests containing recipient address, item details, and service preferences. Returns confirmation with created order identifiers and any validation errors for failed orders. Orders are immediately available for label generation after successful creation.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description is missing entirely. Enhanced summary with 'for shipment' context and added comprehensive description explaining batch processing capability, expected inputs (address, items, preferences), return values (order IDs, errors), and side effect (orders ready for label generation).

message: Operation 'GetOrdersWithDetailsAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary is clear but description only contains access restriction without explaining what the operation returns. Enhanced description to specify what detailed information is included (addresses, items, service details, status history), pagination support, and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Retrieve pageable list of orders with details
data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of orders with complete details for ChannelShipper customers only. Returns comprehensive order information including recipient and sender addresses, item details, service selections, and status history. Supports filtering and sorting through query parameters. Access restricted to ChannelShipper accounts.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description only contains access restriction without explaining what the operation returns. Enhanced description to specify what detailed information is included (addresses, items, service details, status history), pagination support, and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'UpdateOrdersStatusAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is vague about batch capability. Description is completely missing. Improved summary to clarify batch processing and added comprehensive description explaining batch input format, return values, and important side effect that status changes trigger downstream processes.

data.summary_suggestion: Update status for one or more orders
data.description_suggestion: Updates the status for one or more orders in batch. Accepts order identifiers and new status values. Returns confirmation of status updates and any errors for orders that could not be updated. Status changes are immediately reflected in order records and may trigger downstream processes such as label generation or fulfillment workflows.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague about batch capability. Description is completely missing. Improved summary to clarify batch processing and added comprehensive description explaining batch input format, return values, and important side effect that status changes trigger downstream processes.

message: Operation 'DeleteOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate but description needs restructuring for clarity. Reorganized description to lead with the operation purpose, then access restriction, then critical warnings about label invalidation and financial consequences, and finally return information. This structure helps AI agents understand the serious implications before executing the operation.

data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information Please be aware labels generated on orders which are deleted are no longer valid and must be destroyed. Cancelled label information is automatically shared with Royal Mail Revenue Protection, and should a cancelled label be identified on an item in the Royal Mail Network, you will be charged on your account and an additional handling fee applied.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more orders by order identifiers. ChannelShipper customers only. IMPORTANT: Any labels generated for deleted orders become invalid and must be destroyed. Cancelled label information is automatically reported to Royal Mail Revenue Protection. If a cancelled label is identified in the Royal Mail Network, charges and handling fees will be applied to the account. Returns confirmation of deletion and any errors.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description needs restructuring for clarity. Reorganized description to lead with the operation purpose, then access restriction, then critical warnings about label invalidation and financial consequences, and finally return information. This structure helps AI agents understand the serious implications before executing the operation.

message: Operation 'GetSpecificOrdersAsync' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable. Description is missing entirely. Added comprehensive description explaining how to specify which orders (comma-separated IDs), what information is returned, and guidance on when to use this operation versus the paginated list endpoint.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves order information for one or more specific orders identified by order identifiers. Accepts comma-separated order IDs as path parameter. Returns order summary data including status, recipient information, and key order details. Use this operation when you need information about particular orders rather than browsing paginated lists.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description is missing entirely. Added comprehensive description explaining how to specify which orders (comma-separated IDs), what information is returned, and guidance on when to use this operation versus the paginated list endpoint.

data.current_summary: Retrieve details of the specific orders
data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves comprehensive details for one or more specific orders identified by order identifiers. ChannelShipper customers only. Accepts comma-separated order IDs as path parameter. Returns complete order information including recipient and sender addresses, all item details, service selections, pricing, and full status history. Access restricted to ChannelShipper accounts.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description only contains access restriction. Enhanced description to explain how to specify orders (comma-separated IDs), what comprehensive details are included (addresses, items, services, pricing, status history), and clarify the ChannelShipper-only restriction for proper AI agent routing.

data.current_summary: Return a single PDF file with generated label and/or associated document(s)
data.current_description: Reserved for OBA customers only The account "Label format" settings page will control the page format settings used to print the postage label and associated documents. Certain combinations of these settings may prevent associated documents from being printed together with the postage label within a single document. If this occurs the documentType option can be used in a separate call to print missing documents.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate and retrieve postage label PDF for orders
data.description_suggestion: Generates and retrieves a PDF file containing the postage label and associated documents for specified orders. Reserved for OBA customers only. The label format and page settings are controlled by the account's "Label format" settings configuration. Note: Certain format combinations may result in associated documents being generated separately; use the documentType parameter to retrieve missing documents in separate calls if needed. Requires valid order identifiers and Bearer token authentication.

data.current_description: Reserved for ChannelShipper customers only - please visit ChannelShipper.com for more information Please be aware labels generated on orders which are deleted are no longer valid and must be destroyed. Cancelled label information is automatically shared with Royal Mail Revenue Protection, and should a cancelled label be identified on an item in the Royal Mail Network, you will be charged on your account and an additional handling fee applied.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more orders by order identifiers. ChannelShipper customers only. IMPORTANT: Any labels generated for deleted orders become invalid and must be destroyed. Cancelled label information is automatically reported to Royal Mail Revenue Protection. If a cancelled label is identified in the Royal Mail Network, charges and handling fees will be applied to the account. Returns confirmation of deletion and any errors.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description needs restructuring for clarity. Current description mixes access restriction with critical warnings in unclear HTML format. Reorganized to clearly separate access restriction, operation effect, critical warnings about label invalidation and financial consequences, and return value for better AI agent understanding of risks and requirements.
